title: How to Air Condition Your Dog's House
steps: Get the necessary tools.
Choose the doghouse.
Purchase a small air conditioning unit.
Make sure the doghouse is safe.
Cut a hole for the air conditioner.
Install the air conditioner.

title: How to Get Pet Hair Out of Laundry
steps: Run an empty wash cycle after you remove the laundry.
Wipe the drums of the washing machine and dryer if there’s still hair.
Vacuum out any excess hair from the washing machine or dryer.

title: How to Remove Pet Hair
steps: Set a lint roller by the door for a quick once-over before you leave.
Run a piece of tape over your clothes if you don't have a lint remover.
Dry hair-covered clothes before you wash them.

title: How to Get Dog Hair off Furniture
steps: Cover your furniture.
Groom your dog.
Teach your dog not to climb on the furniture.
Consult your vet.

title: How to Reduce Allergies to Dogs
steps: Wear a mask and gloves when bathing and grooming a dog.
Touch dogs as little as possible.
Wash your hands and other exposed skin thoroughly after touching a dog or handling a dog item such as a toy.
Remove and wash your clothing with an allergen reducing detergent promptly after handling a dog.
Discuss medications to reduce allergies to dogs with your doctor.

title: How to Blow Dry a Dog
steps: Get your dog used to the dryer.
Monitor the temperature.
Blow in short increments, if necessary.
Provide ample treats and encouragement.
Avoid the sensitive areas.

title: How to Dry a Dog
steps: Use a hair dryer.
Get your dog used to the blow dryer.
Blow air on the dog's coat.
Keep the dryer moving.
Praise your dog.
Know your dog's limits.

title: How to Wash a Chihuahua
steps: Wait until your dog is dirty to bathe it.
Brush your chihuahua once a day to keep its coat looking good.
Rub your chihuahua down with a damp paper towel or soft washcloth.
Clean your chihuahua's ears with cotton balls and cleaning solution.

title: How to Dye Your Pet
steps: Avoid letting your pet lick the dye.
Watch for an allergic reaction.
Acknowledge color fading.
Observe behavioral changes in your pet.

title: How to Diaper Your Dog with Disposable Dog Diapers
steps: Opt for underwear-style diapers for full coverage.
Choose a belly band style for male dogs with urinary incontinence.
Measure your dog's waist to determine the size diaper you need.
Look for diapers with Velcro fasteners.

title: How to Bathe a Clumsy Dog
steps: Take your dog to the groomer.
Have your vet bathe your dog.
Ask a friend to help you.

title: How to Make Dog Shampoo
steps: Avoid products containing toxic ingredients.
Never use laundry detergent in dog shampoo.
See a vet to treat problems that do not respond to natural treatments.
Watch for signs of an adverse reaction.

title: How to Treat Anaphylactic Shock in a Dog
steps: Avoid exposing your dog to allergens.
Change your dog’s diet if it went into shock because of a food allergen.
Carry emergency medications for your dog if your vet recommends this.

title: How to Give a Dog an Enema
steps: Position your dog.
Fill the enema bulb.
Identify the anus.
Prime the enema pump.
Insert the tubing in a straight line.
Administer the enema solution.
Take your dog to use the bathroom.

title: How to Groom a Hyper Dog
steps: Get your dog ready for their bath.
Thoroughly wet their fur.
Massage shampoo into their coat.
Rinse your dog thoroughly.
Dry your dog.
Restrain your dog for the rest of grooming.
Reward your dog for their good behavior.
